author: adityapatwardhan
body:
Fixes #2190 

## PR Summary

Update-Help needs elevation to update the help content.
This PR adds a functionality to save the updated help content under $HOME to elevation is not required.
To enable this functionality -Scope parameter is added Update-Help.
Scope is defaulted to CurrentUser.
CurrentUser scope saves the help content under $HOME/PowerShell/Help.
Also made changes to Get-Help to lookup help from under $HOME.
Updated and added tests for Update-Help and Get-Help.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed the request to make `CurrentUser` the default scope rather than `AllUsers` which requires elevation/sudo and agrees that we should default to `CurrentUser`.  Although a `Breaking Change`, it will benefit most users and we expect those impacted will be able to solve it easily.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Forgot to post my logic on this one: 

I love it. Been hoping for this for a very long time. I think Jeffrey even filed an issue before alpha went public. 

I'm totally okay with this as a breaking change. Anyone with an advanced enough scenario to take a dependency on the path of the XML, they can figure out what's happening. To be honest, it's most likely to break our own tests in PowerShell-Docs than anything else. 

I think we should throw a warning for a version or two though. I know that we usually say warnings are useless for non interactive scenarios because they're headless, but I think we're getting used more and more in CI and orchestration scenarios where people can go review the console output afterwards. A yellow warning on Appveyor, e.g. would be very useful.

@joeyaiello I can make the changes for updating the default. I would prefer not to add a warning message but, instead get feedback from community if they do not like the new default.

Once this is merged I will make the necessary changes on PowerShell-Docs repo.
